snippet: A day after Mr. Cuomo took a bus tour across upstate New York to court female voters, the governor visited churches to ask black congregants to support his bid for a second term.
abstract: Reporter's Notebook; New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo has been a reluctant campaigner so far this year, wrapping himself in the cocoon of incumbency and waiting patiently for what he clearly hopes will be a landslide re-election; even a comfortable incumbent, however, must give attention to important constituencies, and he has been visiting churches with black congregations and courting female voters.
lead_paragraph: A day after Mr. Cuomo took a bus tour across upstate New York to court female voters, the governor visited churches to ask black congregants to support his bid for a second term.

headline.main: At Churches in Brooklyn and Queens, Cuomo Leaves Campaign Bubble
headline.print_headline: In Church Visits, Cuomo Ventures Outside Campaign Bubble
